title: 2 Timothy: Preach the Word
objective: Finish with Paul's final charge to preach Scripture faithfully and endure to the end.

required_passages.text: All Scripture is breathed out by God... Preach the word... I have fought the good fight, I have finished the race, I have kept the faith.

segments.audio_script: Paul's final words call every minister and disciple to Scripture-rooted endurance.

Listen to 2 Timothy 3-4. Paul warns of difficult times and deceptive teachers, then highlights Scripture's divine authority and usefulness for teaching and training. He solemnly charges Timothy: preach the word in season and out of season. Paul closes with testimony of endurance and confidence in the Lord's righteous crown.
As apostolic era leadership transitions, Scripture-centered preaching becomes the enduring anchor for the church.
Faithful ministry resists novelty by remaining tethered to God's breathed-out word. Finishing well requires steadfast doctrine, courage, and hope in Christ's appearing.
Key themes include Scripture authority, preaching, discernment, perseverance, and finishing the race.
Reflect on this: Are you ordering your life around God's word in a way that will help you finish well?
Preach the word and endure to the end. Next, Titus applies gospel doctrine to church order and public witness.
